Rick Baker: s claim is based on the grades of elementary schools included in his "Mayor's, Mentors and More" program, which included the majority of elementary schools in St. Petersburg starting in 2001.
According to the state data: there were zero A elementary schools from that group in 2001, but at the end of Baker's last full year in office in 2009, the number of A elementary schools had jumped dramatically to 16.
The number of A and B total schools: not just elementary schools) went from seven in July 2001 to 26 in July 2009, an increase of about 271 percent.
